column4: I wanna move my home dir to another partition, How would I do this? I know I would first mount the partition, then cp -r the files over to it... but... what then?

-r may not be enough to get all of the hidden files and everything, I can't remember what the best options would be, but I think maybe you need -a too.  After that, you edit /etc/fstab and point /home to the new partition.

There's already a line in fstab containing /home and it points to your current home partition.  Just change the line to be the new partition (like /dev/sdb3 instead of /dev/hda2 for example).  Remember what you change it from in case you need to change it back because the new copy doesn't work right.
Ah, so your home directory is currently just part of your main partition?
Just a second, I'll message you the line from my fstab.
Did you not see my message?
Ah, I see what happened.  They have messages turned off for those of us who aren't registered because of spam problems.  I'll just say it here.
Just replace /dev/sda2 with whatever your partition is. :)
Also, you should move your old home directory and make a new one before you try to boot with that.
I wouldn't delete it until you're sure that the new one is working right though.
